alert.note: Alert for Hidalgo (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued September 11 at 5:47PM MDT until September 11 at 6:45PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... West central Hidalgo County in southwestern New Mexico... * Until 645 PM MDT. * At 546 PM MDT, an area of blowing dust was over Interstate 10 west of Lordsburg. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong winds up to 55 mph. SOURCE...Department of Transportation traffic cameras. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 22. Locations impacted include... Steins, Lordsburg, Road Forks, Lordsburg Playa, and Shakespeare. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
